vision: A streamlined product development framework that helps solo developers and small teams ship quality products faster by providing structured workflows built on Claude Code.
problem: Claude Code is powerful but developers start each session fresh, losing context and making inconsistent decisions. There's no structured way to maintain project continuity across sessions.
targetUsers: Solo developers and small teams (1-5 people) building web applications who want to move fast without sacrificing quality. They use Claude Code but need better session-to-session continuity.
currentState: MVP - Core skills implemented, basic workflow operational. Used internally for product development.
successCriteria: Developers can resume work seamlessly across sessions without re-explaining context
Key decisions (architecture, UX, specs) are captured and auto-loaded
5-minute setup gets a new project to productive state
constraints: Must work within Claude Code's native skill system - no parallel systems
Keep context files small (<500 tokens each) to minimize session overhead
Zero external dependencies beyond Claude Code
Must be installable via single command
nonGoals: Not a replacement for full project management tools
Not targeting enterprise teams with complex approval workflows
Not building custom UI/dashboard - terminal-first approach
approach: Build incrementally on Claude Code primitives. Each skill captures one type of decision. Auto-load critical context at session start. Prioritize developer experience over feature count.
